Description: Five fragments from the funerary papyrus of a man named Djedmontiufankh, with the titles god's father of Amun and royal despatch scribe of the lord of the two lands; the polychrome vignettes and hieroglyphic text are taken from the Book of the Dead, with eleven portals of the Underworld on the main fragment, Book of the Dead chapter 82 to their left, and on the right hand fragment a vignette of the deceased in control of a hostile crocodile and serpent.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (134786) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/134786)
Taylor et al 2011 / The history and conservation of the papyrus of Tuy (p.98)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Pigments (smudged) Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: torn but solid
